creator: marc@moonscoop-fan.com
text:
Hello,

Apache HTTPD does not seam to support Server Name Indication when IPv6 is used, it chosses the wrong certificate.

I noticed that on one of my website, that works correctly on IPv4 but fails on IPv6 with the error : "Wrong site, the common name (CN) doesn't match". (https://forum.generation-taraddicts.com/)

Don't hesitate to ask me if you need more information to solve this issue.

Thanks in advance !

creator: marc@moonscoop-fan.com
text:
Resolved, it wasn't a bug, it was a mistake in the server configuration, in fact, the certificate had an effect only on one IPv4 (<VirtualHost W.X.Y.Z:443>) and so the IPv6 didn't match with this virtualhost.

Fixed in using <VirtualHost *:443>

Sorry for the inconvienance.
